name: Pseudo Classes
content:
# Pseudo Classes

The [`pseudo-classes`(#d3e965)](/docs/weblab/pseudo-classes/) property is used to add special effects to some selectors. This property can be used mainly to:
* Style an element when a user mouses over it.
* Style visited and unvisited links differently.

examples.name: Unvisited Link
examples.description: Using the `:link` pseudo-class on a link `<a>` element to change color.

examples.name: Mouse Over Link
examples.description: Using the `:hover` pseudo-class on a link`<a>` element to change color.

examples.name: Visited Link

Pseudo Classes
The pseudo-classes property is used to add special effects to some selectors. This property can be used mainly to:
 Style an element when a user mouses over it.
 Style visited and unvisited links differently.
tips:
* `Pseudo-class` are different from CSS classes but they can be combined.
* [`Pseudo-classes`(#d3e965)](/docs/weblab/pseudo-classes/) help you cut down on excess classes in your markup.
